snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry is counting on an Israeli decision to release Palestinian prisoners as the remaining step for his promised resumption of Middle East peace talks, officials said Saturday.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry is counting on Israeli government decision to release long-serving Palestinian prisoners as crucial remaining step for his promised resumption of Middle East peace talks.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry is counting on an Israeli decision to release Palestinian prisoners as the remaining step for his promised resumption of Middle East peace talks, officials said Saturday.

headline.main: Palestinian Prisoner Release Is Critical Hurdle in Resuming  Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Prisoner Release Is a Critical Hurdle in Resuming Peace Talks
